reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed November 2013, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Used the hotel's private pickup service since the transportation seemed a bit complex. Arrived a bit before normal check-in, had an okay lunch, however our balcony room was still not ready. As a result, they upgraded us to suite which was fantastic, though no balcony. Wonderful view of the water and HK island off in the distance from the 7th floor. Room was spacious and had a kitchenette as well which we put to good use for breakfast instead of taking the rather pricey buffet breakfast downstairs, though we did try it the last day and found it just okay. We both had a couple of massages - both my wife's were good, one of mine was much better. Nice pool, though it unfortunately closed for the winter the day after we arrived - had one good swim but it was a bit breezy and pool was not heated - great view though. This place reminded us of the Hilton Millenium in Bangkok - similar layout, big lobby into a waterfront restaurant, great views, but lacking heart or style. It's fairly new and perhaps may develop over time; staff was great and helpful - and plentiful. Lots of dining places at the DB center, though it seemed mostly like a big food court. Don't think we'd go back to DB or this hotel - seemed like we were in an Orange County suburb.
reviews.title: Great hotel but, like Discovery Bay itself, no soul

reviews.text: As an ex-Hong Kong resident myself, I found the transportation getting in and out of the hotel area extremely complicated, especially weekend has different schedules from weekday. Airport shuttle is only available once every hour. Though getting to Central is about 25 min boat ride, one need to wait for & get on the hotel shuttle / bus to get to the Discovery Bay pier first, then wait for the boat. So the door to door travel time is about at least 1 hour. This applies to almost everywhere you need to go, on Lantau island itself or to other parts of hong kong.
reviews.title: very relaxing holiday in a super metropolitan city

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed November 2013, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: other than that, we wish we could stay a bit longer and really loved and enjoyed our stay at the hotel. The hotel surrounding is calm and unlike most of the hotels these days, you would not encounter too many rude tourists from mainland china. Weekend can still be crowded due to weddings and other functions. Sound insulation is excellent, you would not hear frequent passing plane at all. Staff are extremely helpful and dedicated. One staff even walked us to the bus stop when we could not figure out our way. You would not feel like you are in hong kong, but on a tropical island vacation when staying at Auberge D-Bay.
reviews.title: excellent room and excellent service at a convenient price

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed November 2013, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: we just stayed there for a weekend after being in mongkok for business. the room was very big by any standard and had an amazing view, we particularly enjoyed the huge bathtub with a huge window facing the sea. breakfast was fantastic as well as the food in general there, the staff super corteous and helpful, the gym also was nicely equipped. overall it was a very enjoyable experience which i would surely reccomend!
reviews.title: SENSATIONAL .. IN A WORD

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed November 2013, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We hit the jackpot when we booked accommodation at the Auberge .. our preferred option was fully booked and we are now SO happy that it was. We required overnight accommodation near to the airport and the Auberge ticked all of the boxes. So much so this hotel is now our preferred option for all future visits to Hong Kong. The fact that we can and will be able relax in an oasis type setting and be within a 25 min shuttle bus ride to the airport or a short ferry ride to the CBD has so much appeal for my husband and i. The hotel was every bit as impressive as their marketing material suggests, all staff from the moment we walked into the lobby until we departed were very friendly, helpful and professional at all times .. Tommy set the scene at check in .. others mirrored his passion, and his excellent customer service. We loved the place and have no doubt
reviews.title: Excellent relaxed end of a busy holiday

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed November 2013, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Previous reviewers have complained about “soulless” Discovery Bay, but if you stay here, you’re doing it for a reason (or simply haven’t done any research before staying). If you wish to be away from the city, or out among ‘some’ nature, Auberge is perfectly fine. We stayed two nights, just to be close to Disneyland, before checking out and heading across to Hong Kong Island. The staff were very friendly and helpful, the room was spacious, clean, and had quite a large bathroom. We had a Mountain View room that was lovely, but I’d strongly suggest an Ocean/Sea View room, and high up.
reviews.title: Will stay again

reviews.text: The breakfast buffet was very impressive and for just over $20 AUD, there was a fine selection of hot food (dumplings, bacon, eggs, potatoes, beans, waffles, pancakes, soup, sausages etc.), cereals, yoghurt, fruit, pastries, deli meats and cheese. It also all tasted quite fresh and not like it had been sitting out for hours.
reviews.title: Lovely hotel, customer service not great

reviews.text: We got a bus straight from the airport, although not free, it was still convenient. And the shuttle from the Hotel to Disneyland was free and very convenient. There’s a small selection of shops & restaurants just outside the front doors, catering to mostly Westerners as they seem to heavily populate the area, although we didn’t eat there as we’d already eaten dinner at Disneyland, and took off early the next day.
reviews.title: Excellent hotel, excellent location, excellent staff and excellent value

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed November 2013, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Unfortunately the pool had been drained because it's deemed too cold for use. It's a shame the spa wasn't available but I understand it can't be available all the time.
reviews.title: Awesome hotel

reviews.text: Context to following review:
reviews.title: Beautiful view, weak service, bad location

reviews.text: I stayed here one night in November.
reviews.title: Excellent

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed November 2013, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: A very beautiful hotel in a very beautiful location in Discovery Bay.
reviews.title: Perfect for leisure within a busy city

reviews.text: Very helpful staff. Nice and convenient room. Good AC and room safe bolted down. WiFi is free in the lobby, and for charge in the room. But you also have cable for Internet in the room. Great breakfast buffet with good selection, quality produce and sitting with view to the bay.
reviews.title: A slice of paradise in HK.
Lovely stay.
reviews.text: Make sure to specify bay view when you make your reservation, or you are most likely to get mountain view...

reviews.title: Awesome
reviews.text: While many sites indicate free hotel coach, this true for destinations other than Honk Kong airport.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed December 2013, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Our stay of three nights was comfortable, relaxing and very pleasant. We had an 'Ocean Front Deluxe' room, with (small) balcony, which was great. Very comfortable and clean. It seems only a few rooms have balconies, which is a shame, because I'm sure the balcony makes a big difference if the weather is good (it was for us, early December) and you are not rushing off to Disneyland, Giant Buddha, or whatever. It would be even nicer if there were a couple of small chairs on the balcony! Good view of the ocean/harbour, nearby hills, distant islands (on a clear day!), Disneyland fireworks (every night). The bathroom is a bit special, with huge picture window view from the shower/bath (if you don't lower the modesty blind).
reviews.title: A comfortable, relaxing couple of days

reviews.text: Outside, at the back of the hotel there is an extensive terrace overlooking the sea, with nice landscaping, and seats. (Also swimming pool, but not in use during our stay.) The restaurant opens onto this terrace. Food at the restaurant was excellent. A special mention here for our waiter Moonhee who was an attentive, polite, quick to learn trainee. Breakfast buffet was extremely good.
reviews.title: Fire Safety

reviews.text: The hotel is part of the Discovery Bay North Plaza, with buses to the main Discovery Bay (where we arrived by ferry from Central HK) and other parts. The plaza has a very useful, large(ish) supermarket selling everything ex-pats could want (including both Marmite and Vegemite), places to sit, and three cafes - an Indian, basic but good pizzeria, and nice International. A short sea-front promenade leads to a beach. There are lots of ex-pats (from various Western countries) around and middle-class Asians, and they all seem predominantly to be young couples with kids - LOTS of kids who are generally noisy, over-excited and under-disciplined! And of course the hotel is a favourite for people (with more kids) going to Disneyland (especially on weekend).
reviews.title: Revitalizing break for us
Becareful of transportation
reviews.text: There's not much to do at Discovery Bay, but that's not a bad thing if you just want to relax for a couple of days.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed November 2013, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Beware of the attitude of the Auberge to fire safety. Our room was on the 15th floor. On the morning of our check out we found that all the elevators had returned to "home" on the ground floor. We were told that this was because of a fire alarm. There was a strong smell of cigarette smoke in the corridor. Neither we nor other guests heard any alarm. There was no evacuation of the building. On eventually reaching the reception desk, we were told in a very casual manner that it was a "false alarm". The attitude of staff (and presumably management) is wrong; the safety first principle should always lead to evacuation.
reviews.title: Secluded
